revised_title: Observations on the Movement of the Glass Case of a Radiometer
tldr: William Crookes investigates the movement of the glass case of a radiometer when exposed to radiation from candles and a magnet. He observes that the glass case rotates in the opposite direction when a magnet is brought near, and discusses the internal friction affecting the movement. This study contributes to the understanding of the underlying mechanisms of radiometers and their response to external forces.
